title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
AT&T is in advanced talks to combine its WarnerMedia division with Discovery, in a deal that would unwind the telecom giant's signature bet on media as pressure on the traditional entertainment business mounts.

---

Microsoft directors decided Bill Gates needed to leave the company's board in 2020 as they probed his prior romantic relationship with a female staffer.

---

U.S. companies across industries have been buying back stock and raising dividends at a brisk pace this year, in a sharp reversal from 2020.

---

The CDC's updated pandemic guidance is raising questions among employers about whether to speed up employees' return to the office.

---

At Home's largest shareholder plans to oppose a deal to take the retailer private because it says the sale price is too low.

---

Bright Machines is nearing a merger with a SPAC to go public in a deal that would value the company at about $1.6 billion.

---

JD.com's logistics arm is looking to raise as much as $3.4 billion through an initial public offering in a Hong Kong listing.
